messages.message: Do we have a preferred format for displaying timezones on the platform? Either UTC offset (UTC-4) or location-based (America/New_York)?
I guess the ideal would be displaying the short timezone (like EST) but all the solutions for that I’m seeing seem a little hacky

For the short timezone (EST, PDT), we can pass in options to `toLocaleDateString` or `toLocaleTimeString`
```now.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {timeZoneName: "short"})```
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleTimeString#using_options
i think we should display the time in the user's time zone
I think that is how we have in Deployment Manager

I think the problem here is that users aren't sure that the displayed time is in the user's time zone. We want to add some indication to assure users that the displayed time is indeed their local timezone.

I think if we base it on the user, it will depend on their IP address location?

So, for example, if I live in the CST timezone but connect through a VPN in the EST timezone, it would show EST?

Maybe we should make the timezone setting customizable?

The time zone show up in the front end will be based on the browser setting, which usually depends on system setting. VPN changes the IP address but the time zone doesn’t change automatically based on the IP address. I don’t think we need to consider such case. 

Making the time zone configurable would require much more work: we need a way to track user’s setting, preferably in the DB.
Jet- in your example, it will show the time in CST, unless you configured your OS to use other time zone
